mods.abstract: Eliza Magruder was a young woman living at Locust Plantation near Natchez, Mississippi, the home of her aunt and uncle, Olivia Magruder Dunbar and Joseph Dunbar. Her diary details the day to day life and activities of plantation women. She comments on local social events and amusements, visiting friends, births and deaths, and treatment, care of, and unrest of slaves; records illness and death among slaves and friends and medical attention she provided, as well as her reading, sewing, and religious life; and relates her aunt's activities as mistress of the plantation, before and after her husband's death in 1846.

titleInfo.title: Joseph D. Shields and Family Papers, Mss. 654

copyInformation.subLocation: LSU Special Collections: Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Manuscript Collection

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
